content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is sitting in the living room and Phoebe is standing in the kitchen as the phone rings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs? Could you get that? Please?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why? Just ’cause you’re too lazy to get up off your touchie?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No! It’s just that all the people in the entire world that I want to talk to are right here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay! (Goes to answer the phone.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sucker!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Hey Joey!
[Cut to Las Vegas, Joey is on the phone and wearing his gladiator costume.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs! Listen, uh can you do me a favor? I forgot the pin number to my ATM card can, can you get it for me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure! Where is it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, I scratched it on the ATM machine down on the corner.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! So you’re 5639?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s it! Thanks Pheebs!
[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, do you want to talk to Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that Joey?! (She nods yes) Let me talk to him!
[Cut to Joey]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! (She nods no to Chandler) Because he didn’t believe in my movie! Which is a big mistake because it is real! Real!

content.speaker: A Casino Boss
content.text: Hey! Tribbiani! Get back to work! Break time’s over!
[Cut to Phoebe]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who was that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, my stunt double. Yeah, and y’know, he’s getting a little too familiar for my tastes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what? I have been trying to apologize to him all week! If he’s not gonna let me do it on the phone, I’m gonna go down there and do it in person.
[Cut to Joey]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh Pheebs, I heard that. Can you put him on?
[Cut to Phoebe]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! (She hands the phone to Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!
[Cut to Joey]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t come out here!
[Cut to Chandler]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no-no-no, I’ve supported you one hundred percent and I want to prove that to you in person!
[Cut to Joey]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got that! I forgive ya! Don’t come out here!
[Cut to Chandler]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Forgive me? You haven’t been taking my calls in a week!
[Cut to Joey]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’m totally over it Chandler. Friends forever! Don’t come out here!

content.speaker: A Tourist
content.text: Would you mind doing a picture with us?
[Cut to Chandler]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, what was that?
[Cut to Joey]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, Entertainment Tonight . [Cut to Chandler] Yeah, okay so, good talking to ya and don’t come out here. All right. (Hangs up the phone and poses for that picture.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is entering.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica! I’m sorry I’m late! (Starts looking around for her) Monica? (Goes into Monica’s bedroom.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe? (Phoebe comes back into the living room) Oh, Phoebe, I’m so sorry. Have you been here long?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s okay. What the hell took you so long?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, you can not tell Chandler. Okay? That I ran into Richard.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Which Richard?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The Richard.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Richard Simmons?! Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noo! My ex-boyfriend Richard! Y’know the tall guy, moustache?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Okay, that actually makes more sense. So how was it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was, it was really nice. We started talking and I-I ended up having lunch with him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is so weird! I had a dream that you’d have lunch with Richard.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But again, Simmons. Go on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The strange part was, he was really nice, umm and he looks great, but I didn’t feel anything at all!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! So now why can’t we tell Chandler?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because it would totally freak him out and tomorrow’s our anniversary. I just don’t want anything to spoil that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I can’t believe you guys lasted a whole year!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! I owe Rachel 20 bucks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: On a totally different bet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s almost our anniversary!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know. Can you believe it? One year ago today I was just your annoying friend Chandler.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Awww! Now you’re just my annoying friend Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I got you a present!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, but it’s not ’til tomorrow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know, but you have to open it today! (Hands it too him.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay.
(He starts taking his time opening it. Finally Monica snaps.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay! There you go! It’s two tickets to Vegas!
content.parenthetical: grabbing the gift from him and opening it

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: For this weekend! Oh gosh, it would be perfect, we get to see Joey plus we get to start our anniversary celebration on the plane. We can call it out plane-aversary.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do we have to?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay this is great, but Joey said he didn’t want any of us out there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, he just doesn’t want us to go through any trouble. Think of how excited he’ll be when we go out and surprise him! Plus we get to have our own, ani-Vegas-ary! A-Nevadaversary!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I think we should see other people.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But we can go, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a great idea. (They kiss)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, I’m gonna go too!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know Pheebs, it’s kinda our (His and Monica’s) anniversary.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh please, you are not gonna ditch again like you did with London.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ditch you? Phoebe, you were pregnant with the triplets!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh, great story! I’m going!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, you guys, listen, this weekend we’re all gonna go to Las Vegas to surprise Joey! Including me!! You wanna go?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I guess I could take a couple days off work.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Of course you can take a couple days off work because this trip includes me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, wait a minute, wait, I’ve got a presentation tomorrow. I can’t miss that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, but I’ve got tickets to the Van Gogh exhibit! I’ve been waiting like a year for this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Art lover!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’d you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I said art lover.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that supposed to be an insult?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know, I’m very tired.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So Rach, maybe you and I could fly out together Saturday.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That sounds great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah? All right I’ll call the airlines. (Picks up the phone and does so)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Yeah, that would be nice actually, to have the apartment to myself for a night.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, so you can walk around naked.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! So I can be by myself. Y’know? Have a little alone time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Naked alone time.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Phoebe just because I’m alone doesn’t mean I wanna walk around naked. I mean, you live alone, you don’t walk around naked.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh! Why do you think it takes me so long to answer the door?

content.description: An airplane cabin, Phoebe has the aisle seat, Chandler the window, and Monica’s stuck in that horrible middle seat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, so far is this trip to Vegas better or worse than the trip to London?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So it’s pretty much the same Pheebs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, what about after I give you these candies? (Hands them each one from her purse.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I guess it’s a little better now.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah-ha! Okay, (takes out a notepad) Las Vegas 1, London 0! I’ll be right back. (Gets up and heads aft.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Happy plane-aversary.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww! I love you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can I give you a present now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (He grabs his carryon and starts rummaging through it.) Oh man! Don’t tell me I did this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love the “I forgot the present” fake out!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How do you feel about the, “I really did forgot the present, please forgive me” not fake out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s okay. Don’t worry about it, you can give it to me when we get back.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh that’s the worse thing that can happen on an anniversary ever!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good! All right, so you decided to tell him about the Richard thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What-what Richard thing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no. [The patented version.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What Richard thing?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Simmons! Go with Simmons!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I umm, I ran into Richard yesterday and he asked me if I wanted to go for a bite and I did. The only reason I didn’t tell you is because I knew you’d get mad and I didn’t want to spoil our anniversary.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m not mad.
content.parenthetical: talking out of the side of his mouth

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah! Yeah, so you-you bumped into Richard! You grabbed a bite! It’s no big deal. (He still ain’t happy.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great!
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, London 1…

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is coming out of the bathroom after a shower wearing only her bath robe, walks into the kitchen, and opens the fridge. As she bends over to grab a bottle of wine, her robe falls open (Damn this network primetime programming, we didn’t see anything!) and she quickly closes it again. But then realizes she didn’t have to do that. So she closes the fridge and stands next to the table, thinks about it for a little while and…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Look what happened! {Don’t get your hopes up guys, we only get to see her from the back or from the neck up. Its times like these I wish that the networks would broadcast some nudity other than Denis Franz’s butt.} (In her head.) Huh, check me out! I’m in my kitchen…naked! I’m picking up an orange. (Does so) I’m naked! (Goes into the living room) Lighting the candles, naked, and carefully. (She backs anything that might have a point like a candle on her body away.)
[Cut to Ross’s apartment, he’s sitting by his window looking at an art book. As he’s turning the page, he glances up and notices something.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! That’s Rachel naked! I can’t look at that! I am looking at this. (Looks back at his book.) Okay, vivid colors, expressive brush strokes — Unless she wants me to be looking at that. She knows I’m home. She knows I can see her. What kind of game is she playing? I think maybe someone’s lonely tonight. Oh-ho, Dr. Geller! Stop it! You’re being silly! Or, am I?

[Cut back to Monica and Rachel’s apartment, Rachel is singing along with a song and dancing while facing the big picture window. Y’know, I think I’d pay real good money to be on the other side of that window!]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Love to love ya baby! Ow! Love to love ya baby! Ow! (There’s a knock on the door, she turns off the music, puts on her robe, and goes to answer the door.) Love to love ya, baby! (There’s another knock.) Darnit! (Looks through the peephole and turns on the lights.) Ugh. (She opens the door to Ross who’s leaning against the door jam.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the scene is continued from where we left off before the break.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: May I come in?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, yeah, if you want too.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you want me too?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, sure?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So do I. (Slowly walks in.) Okay Rach, before anything happens (He takes off his coat) I just want to lay down a couple of ground rules. (Turns back to face her.) This is just about tonight. I don’t to go through with this if it’s going to raise the question of “Us.” (Rachel’s confused) Okay? I just want this to be (Kicks off his left shoe) about what it is! (Kicks off the other one.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And um, what-what is that Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The physical act of love. (Hisses at her.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Are you crazy?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh so-so you weren’t trying to entice me just now with your-your nakedness?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, you saw me?! Oh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You weren’t trying to entice me with your nakedness.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noo!! No! You thought, you actually thought I wanted to have sex with you?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! (Grabs his coat) No! (Grabs a shoe.) No-no-no-no. (Grabs the other one and heads for the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh wow! I’m sorry, but Ross you kicked off your shoes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can we, can we just forget this ever happened?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes of course, absolutely! You’re right. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right I guess I’m, gonna go pack. (Starts to leave)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Oh wait! One more thing umm, do-do we still need to uh settle the question of “us?”
(Ross storms off embarrassed.)

content.description: [Scene: Las Vegas, we have the typical glamour shots of Vegas, the Strip, slot machines, a couple other gaming tables all set to the tune of you guessed it, Money. Anyhoo, we finally get through that and watch Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe enter Caesar’s Palace carrying their luggage.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys wait! Guys! (Catches up to them.) This place is so much better than London! Okay? This lady dressed like Cleopatra gave me a coupon, 99 cent steak and lobster dinner. Huh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you don’t eat animals.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: For 99 cents, I’d eat you. (Sees the casino) Okay, I can totally settle down here. It’s got everything I could ever want, including Joey! Look! (Points to Joey in his gladiator suit posing for a picture with two old ladies.) Oh! Look! Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Joey! (They all head over to him, he spots them coming and panics.) Hey! Hey!! Wow! (She hugs him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Love your condoms my man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What-what are you guys doing here? I thought I told you not to come.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why are you dressed as a gladiator?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, because I’m shooting a scene right now. Yeah, I uh, I play a gladiator. Uh, y’know what? Hold-hold on a second. (To no one in particular) Can we cut? Yeah, my-my friends are here, I’m gonna take a little break.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who are you talking too?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They uh director. Uhh, her. (Points to an old woman standing behind him. Who glares at him and walks off.) All right, all right, it’s not a gladiator movie. I work here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?! What happened?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, the movie got shutdown because they ran out of money, so I’m working here ’til it starts up again, if it ever does.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I’m sorry I didn’t tell ya. (To Chandler) I’m sorry man.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No-no, that’s okay, apparently there’s a new policy where we don’t have to share everything with everybody.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I knew you were not okay with that.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you’re a gladiator! Wow!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, what-what’s going on?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica had lunch with Richard.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dawson?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Noo! But that would’ve been so cool!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! Her boyfriend Richard!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It meant nothing! Okay? After all this time, how can you not trust me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: When you go lunching with hunky moustache men and don’t tell me about it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re right. I’m sorry. I should’ve told you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks. (They hug.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww, there we go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I love Vegas!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I promise you, next time I will absolutely tell you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Next time?
content.parenthetical: pushing her away from another hug

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, so close.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There’s not gonna be a next time! You can not ever see him again!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can not see him? I mean, you can’t tell me what to do!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s so funny, because I think I just did!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh y’know what? If you’re gonna be acting like this all night, I really, I don’t even want to be around you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine with me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine! Happy Anniversary!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! Whoa! Guys! Please! Come on! Come on! This is obviously just a big misunderstanding.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No it is not!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What are you talking…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey don’t look at me! I just work here! (Walks away.)

content.description: An aircraft cabin, Ross and Rachel are on their way to Vegas.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay umm, Ross? I’m-I’m really warm, so I’m going to be taking off my sweater. Now, I’m just letting you know that this is not an invitation to the physical act of love.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yep! That’s hilarious!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m done. I’m done.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know, last night was embarrassing for you too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, not really. I mean you’ve seen me naked hundreds of times.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh. But it was a first for the rest of my building.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. All right, that’s true! But y’know I just don’t embarrass that easily.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! You totally get embarrassed!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I don’t! Ross, I think I’m just a more secure person than you are.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that so?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey lady! I don’t care how much you want it! Okay?! I am not gonna to have sex with you in the bathroom! (Rachel sinks lower on her chair trying to hide.)
content.parenthetical: loudly so that everyone can hear

content.description: Chandler’s hotel room, he’s sitting there with Joey who’s talking about his helmet and running his hand through that feathery thing at the top.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, y’know in Roman times this was more than just a hat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, sure! Sure! They would uh, they would scrub the floors with it! They would use it to get the mud off their shoe. And sometimes underneath the horse would get dirty so they would stick it right…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey, I uh! I can’t believe this is how I’m spending my anniversary.
content.parenthetical: interrupting in the nick of time

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right well, I’ll take you someplace nice then. Look! A guy tipped me a hundred bucks today.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, he was playing blackjack for like an hour and he won $5,000. Can you believe that? $5,000!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, if I won $5,000 I’d join a gym, y’know build up my upper body and hit Richard from behind with a stick! (Mimics it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait a minute! Why don’t I do what that guy did? I’ll take this $100 and turn it into $5,000! And then I’ll turn that into enough money to get my movie going again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good luck!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler! I don’t need luck. I have thought this through!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I see.
(Joey exits as Chandler shakes his head.)

content.description: [Scene: The casino bar, Phoebe and Monica are sitting at the bar, while Wayne Newton’s signature song Danke Schoen is playing in the background.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe this! This is like the worst night ever!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know Monica you had a minor setback in your relationship with Chandler. Big deal! It’s only Chandler. (Monica turns and stares at her.) I am so sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is crazy! I mean, it’s such a stupid argument. I don’t even wanna see Richard again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So go fix it! Go find Chandler! He’s probably up in your room! Tell him that you’re sorry and that you love him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? You’re right Phoebe. You’re right. Thank you! (Gets up to find Chandler.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sure! (When Monica gets close to the door.) (Yelling) Yeah! Las Vegas, number one!
[Cut to the casino, Monica is walking through it past the craps table when she notices a chip on the floor. She picks it up and heads to the table.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Anybody lose this? (Holds up the chip and the woman next to her shakes her head no.)

content.speaker: The Croupier
content.text: Comin’ out. Place your bet. (Monica does so.) Dice are out. (The woman next to Monica rolls the dice.) Double or nothin’! Pay the front line! (Monica won and doubled the chip.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm.

content.description: An airplane cabin, Ross and Rachel are both reading as a guy stops by their row.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: So uh, I’m on my way back to the bathroom. (Ross giggles.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, all right. All right! Just keep walkin’! All right?
(Ross keeps giggling and Rachel decides upon revenge. She gets up and kisses the rather large man in the seat in front of Ross on the back of his head. The guy turns around angrily.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross! What are you… I’m sorry sir. I just, I think he just really likes you.
[Time lapse, Ross is drinking something and decides to get Rachel again.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! Y’know that teacher who had a baby with her student? (He points at Rachel.)
content.parenthetical: to the guy in the window seat next to him

content.text: [Time lapse, Rachel pushes the flight attendant call button, takes Ross’s drink, and spills it into his lap.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What the? What…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!
content.parenthetical: to the flight attendant who appears in record time. It was only seconds after Rachel pushed the call button was she there. Once again, more proof that TV isn’t real, IRL she would’ve been waiting for the rest of the flight and by then Ross’s pants would be dry.

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Miss? May I help you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, I’m sorry. Do you have any extra pants? Umm, my friend seems to have had a little accident.

content.description: [Scene: Caesar’s Palace Casino, Joey is approaching one of the blackjack tables on his quest to make enough money for his movie.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Can I change a hundred? (He hands him his chip.)

content.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
content.text: Changing one hundred! (Gives him the change.) Good luck sir.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Let’s ride.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hit me! (He does so.) Ohh man! (Joey busts and loses all the money, but when the dealer starts to collect the cards Joey notices something.) Wait! (He holds his hand next to the dealer’s hand.)
[Cut to Chandler’s room, Joey is relaying to Chandler his amazing discovery.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler! You are not gonna believe this! I have found my identical hand twin!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My identical hand twin!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s an identical hand twin?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s it sound like? It’s a guy with my identical hands! It was incredible! Chandler, the dealer’s hands were exactly like me! It-it was like looking at my hands in a mirror!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you sure you weren’t (pause) looking at your hands in a mirror?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Don’t you see what this means?! I can forget about that stupid movie. I’m gonna be a millionaire!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, I don’t have it all worked out yet, but it’s gotta mean big money! Come on! Identical hands!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Again I must go back to, how?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is Vegas man! People will pay to see freaky stuff! Okay, how much would you pay to see this hand (Holds up his left hand) twice? Huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I-I can’t really put a price on that Joe.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, are you unsupporting me again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! No! I support you 100%! I just didn’t, I didn’t get it right away. Y’know now I’m caught up! Identical hand twins! It’s a million-dollar idea!

(Joey starts to leave to embark on his genius moneymaking scheme, but is freaked out slightly when as he goes to open the door, there’s a mysterious knock. He calms himself down and opens the door to reveal Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I found my identical hand twin!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, you are so lucky! (To Chandler) Hey! So, where’s Monica? Did you guys make up?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But she just came up here!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was Joey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I wonder where she is. That is so weird.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, well, she’s probably talking to Richard.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Would you stop that! Do you wanna know the first thing she said when she came back from her lunch with Richard? She didn’t feel anything for him. She loves you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! Now, she feels terrible! She really wants to make up! You gotta find her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (He gets up and goes to find her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good. (After he leaves, she puts on Joey’s gladiator helmet and checks herself out in the mirror) I should really start wearing hats!

content.description: [Scene: Caesar’s Palace Casino, Chandler is looking for Monica while Tom Jones’s signature song is playing in the background (Getting the theme yet? Tom Jones, Wayne Newton, casinos… They’re in Vegas people! Catch up!) It’s Not Unusual, y’know, “It’s not unusual to be loved by anyone! It’s not unusual to have fun with anyone! But when I see you hanging about with anyone, it’s not unusual to see me cry! I wanna die.” Well, while that’s playing he spots Monica playing craps and in victory hug the guy next to her. Chandler turns and walks out.]

That same plane cabin, Ross is working on a crossword puzzle and Rachel is asleep against his shoulder. She shifts a little bit and Ross suddenly gets an idea. An evil idea when he looks at his pen. Then we have a little time lapse, the plane has landed and everyone is disembarking. The flight attendant is saying bye-bye to everyone.

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Welcome to Las Vegas.
(Rachel approaches and we see the fruits of Ross’s evil plan. He has drawn a moustache and beard on Rachel. The flight attendant just ignores it.)

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Thank you! (Not sure of herself) Enjoy your flight?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, I did. Thank you very much, it was excellent. (Disembarks)

content.speaker: Flight Attendant
content.text: Hope you had a nice flight.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, it was the best!

content.description: The casino, Ross and Rachel are entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think the check in is that way. (Points)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh.
(A young boy sees Rachel, points, and starts laughing.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello! (She makes a face and the kid laughs harder. Finally, his parents drag him off.) Ohh, kids love me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebe! (They hug.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys are here! Yay!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! (Hugs Phoebe)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? Did you go to a costume party? Let me guess umm Pancho Vila? (Points at Rachel) and you’re Bob Saget. (An old lady has sat down at the slot machine Phoebe was just at.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pancho Vila?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! (Motions to her face, indicating all of Rachel’s “make-up.”)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you talking about Pheebs? (Takes out her compact) I don’t… (She gasps when she looks in the mirror and sees her face.) (To Ross) Oh my God, you drew on me?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you wet my pants!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa, what kind of party was this?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I have been walking around like this since the plane! I can—you have so crossed a line. (Heads for the bathroom)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach! Wait! The men’s room is that way. (Points in the other direction. Rachel hits him with her purse and heads for the ladies room.)
(The old lady at Phoebe’s machine wins. Phoebe turns around in shock.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s like the third time that lady’s won on a machine I was playing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oooohhh, I’ll bet she’s one of those people.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: M-M-Mole people?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? No-no, a lurker.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. What’s a lurker?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay when you’re playing a machine and it hasn’t paid out, a lurker waits for you to give up and then…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Kills you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. They swoop in and steal your jackpot.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How do you know about this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: My nana used to do it. That’s how she paid for all my dance—karate lessons.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Dance karate?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, it’s a deadly but beautiful sport. (Does a karate chop, then does a little dance-type sway.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, it won’t come off!
content.parenthetical: returning with her purse covering her face

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It won’t come off!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my God! Rach-Rach, are-are-are you sure?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, actually I took it off then I drew it back on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey-hey-hey you made it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right! Hey-hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who’s your friend? He’s hot! (Ross laughs and Rachel smacks him with her purse.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks man.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. (She hugs Joey.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey listen I uh, talked to Chandler, sorry about the movie.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, don’t be sorry. I don’t need it anymore. I found my identical hand twin!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: My identical hand twin! The person whose hands are exactly like mine! This thing is a gold mine!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! That’s not gonna make you any money!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Well, if that’s how you feel about it, fine! None of you get to live with me in my great big hand-shaped mansion! Except uh, you Pheebs. You can live in the thumb.

content.description: The craps table, Monica is on a big roll.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right baby, come on! (Rolls the dice) Yes! Yes! I am on fire!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See you later Mon.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait Chandler, what are you doing?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What does it look like? I’m going home.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What? Wait! Why? (He turns and heads for the door and she chases after him.) Chandler! Chandler! Wait! I’m sorry, I was just playing for one second! I was trying to find you to tell you that, look if you don’t want me to see Richard again, I won’t! He means nothing to me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on! I was there! (He’s propped up with his hand on a statute of a naked guy. He winces and pulls his hand away.) I know he’s the love of your life.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not any more.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really! (They hug and kiss) All right? Let’s forget about this going home stuff and celebrate our anniversary. (She picks up his suitcase.) Okay, this is empty.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I wanted to make a dramatic scene, but I hate packing.

content.description: A blackjack table, it’s the same one Joey’s hand twin was working at, only he’s not there anymore and has been replaced by a beautiful woman.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, hey. Where’s the other guy?

content.speaker: The Woman Dealer
content.text: Which guy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He’s kinda tall, dark hair, hand looks exactly like this. (Holds up his hand.) See?

content.speaker: The Woman Dealer
content.text: I don’t know about the hands, but the guy that was here before me just went to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! (Walks away, then turns back.) How you doin’?

content.speaker: The Woman Dealer
content.text: Very busy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right! Okay. (Heads for the bathroom.)

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s hotel room, Rachel is still trying to get the ink off and Ross is on the phone to the company. Wait a minute, why exactly are they sharing a hotel room? Didn’t they like break-up or something? Did I miss a memo? Or maybe, it’s just foreshadowing things to come. Who knows? Maybe the answer’s at the bottom of the page. Then again, maybe it isn’t and it’s just one of those things TV writers just don’t explain. Anyhoo…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, hello. I have a question. Umm, I used your pen to draw on my friend’s face. (Listens) A beard and a moustache. (Listens and laughs) Thank you. (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) No, she didn’t think so. (Listens) I know it’s like (turns and sees Rachel staring at him and quickly changes the subject) anyway, umm well make-up didn’t cover it and we’ve tried everything to get it off and nothing’s worked. What-what do we do? (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) Yeah. (Listens) Oh! Okay. (Listens) Okay, thank you! (Rachel gets excited at his tone.) (Hangs up the phone) Yeah, it’s not coming off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! What else did he say?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, he said he thought I was funny. So…(Rachel stares at him.) Okay, look-look umm, let’s just go downstairs, we’ll have some fun, and you will forget all about it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, no! There is no way I am leaving this room looking like this!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, come on! Rach, it’s-it’s not that bad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, I am a human doodle!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, just because some idiot drew on your face doesn’t mean you shouldn’t have any fun! Okay? And besides, hey-hey-hey no one is even gonna look at you. Okay? This is Vegas! Hello! There are tons of other freaks here! (Rachel turns around and glares at him.) There are tons…of…freaks here. No other. No. Come on! No one will notice, I swear!
(They both exit.)
[Time lapse, they’re both entering.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, there was some staring and pointing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, I need a, I need a drink! (Makes a beeline for the mini-bar.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, hey y’know, they-they really overcharge you for that stuff. (Rachel glares at him.) But who cares?! Because it’s all on me! (Rachel reaches into the fridge and pulls out two handfuls of those mini booze bottles.) (Watching her.) That is, one big drink!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Macadamia nut?
content.parenthetical: she’s finished reliving the fridge of its entire alcohol content.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm… Wow! That’s-that’s some pricey nut!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hm-mmm! (Opens the container)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really like those Macadamia nuts, huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nope! (She puts one in her mouth and spits it out, then does it again in another direction.)

content.description: The casino, Phoebe is playing on a slot machine. Suddenly the lurker sticks her head around the aisle of slot machines.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Get out of here you lurker! (She doesn’t move) Go on! Get! (She throws a quarter at her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh! You made up!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I couldn’t be mad at him for too long.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, she couldn’t live without the Chan Love. (They start kissing.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, get a room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We have one.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know. Use it.

content.description: The Men’s room, Joey is entering and sees his hand twin washing his hands.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh-oh, yeah! (He grabs some towels and takes them to him.) That’s right, you take good care of those babies!

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Excuse me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s me, Joey!

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Do I know you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Oh-ho, yeah. Yeah, the hand guy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, so what are we going to do about this hand twin thing?!

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Nothing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, you and I have been given a gift. Okay? We have to do something with it. Like-like, hand modeling! Huh? Or-or magic! And you know NASA’s gonna wanna talk to us!

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: I have to get back to…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! Whoa-whoa! We could have our own show! Y’know we could clap our hands together people will love it! Huh? And-and-and I wrote a song for us! (Singing, to the tune of This Land is Your Land ) This hand is your hand! This hand is my hand! Oh wait, that’s your hand! No wait, it’s my hand!

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: That’s okay. (Walks out.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But you haven’t even heard the chorus!

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s room, Ross is drinking a beer while Rachel is examining herself in the mirror.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, I’m starting to look like my great aunt, Muriel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right. Y’know what? We don’t have to go downstairs! We can bring Vegas up to us! (He grabs a deck of cards and pulls up a chair.) All right, come on, come on, we’ll play some blackjack. Here we go. (Deals the cards.) 13.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hit me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oohh, 23. (Rachel looks at him.) Which is what we play to at this casino! You win 10 dollars! (Holds out a ten.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I bet 20.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re right! (Gives her the twenty she won.)

content.description: The Craps Table, Monica is still on her roll, only this time Chandler’s with her and she has a huge crowd of people around.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: A new pair of shoes for the Chan-Chan man! (Rolls the dice.) Yes!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! I’ve-I’ve never seen a roll like this in my life!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right baby! Okay, what do I want now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, ah umm, ah, a 8. Ah, a 6?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Pick a number! That is your only job!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thank you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If you get this one, we buy everybody here a steak dinner!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yay!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yay!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’re not really gonna buy these people steak dinners are we?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noo!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, good! Okay, what do I want now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, ooh, try a hard 8.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Two fours.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (Rolls the dice)

content.speaker: A Drunken Gambler
content.text: Don’t you let her go! You’re a lucky guy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you, Mister Drunken Gambler! Okay, you get this and uh, we get the biggest suite in the place! (Everyone cheers) Wait-wait-wait-wait! We (motions to Monica and him.) get the biggest suite in the place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, biggest suite in the place. Come on! (Rolls the dice.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!! I love you! I can’t even remember what we were fighting about!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s because I had lunch with Rich—Me neither! Okay, what do I want now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Another hard 8.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hard 8?! We should call it easy 8!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, okay, I tell you what. You roll another hard eight; (pause) and we get married here tonight.

content.speaker: Drunken Gambler
content.text: Go! Come on! Roll!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Roll-roll!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up!! It just got interesting!

content.description: The Craps table, continued from earlier.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What did you just say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You roll another hard eight and we get married here tonight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you serious?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! I love you! I’ve never loved anybody as much as I love you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ve never loved anybody as much as I love you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, so if an eight comes up, we take it as a sign and we do it! {Whoa! Where have I heard that before? Matthew Perry talking about signs in Las Vegas. I guess it must’ve been some movie I saw.} What do you say?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! Come on! Let’s go! All right!
(She rolls the dice, but one bounces out of the table.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! That’s a four! And where-where’s the other one?

content.speaker: Drunken Gambler
content.text: It went under the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nobody move! (To Chandler) Okay, you look that way; I’ll look this way!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right!

(He searches to his right; she searches to her left. They’re both on their hands and knees when they spot the die. It’s propped up against the table leg, and it’s not lying flat. Both the four and the five are showing.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here it is! Here it is!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That could be a four or a five. It’s your call.
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s a four.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think so too.

(Cue up the music as they move in and kiss. This time I think it’s Perry Como, but I’m not sure. It’s Everybody loves somebody, sometime! Everybody falls in love somehow! Something in your kiss, just told me, my sometime, is now!)

content.description: The slot machines, Phoebe is still feeding quarters into the one-armed bandit as the lurker peeks over the top of the machines.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh well, lost again. (She gets up and slowly moves away. The lurker scurries in and takes her spot, only this time Phoebe set a trap for her and catches her in the act.) That’s it! You and me, outside!

content.speaker: The Lurker
content.text: I don’t want to see you lose a chunk of that pretty blond hair!
(They start smacking each other’s cups, but Phoebe notices a security guard approaching.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Be cool! (They both pretend to have a nice conversation as the guard walks by, but after he leaves they both start fighting again.) Okay lady, your lurking days are over!

content.speaker: The Lurker
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, from now on everyone you lurk, I’m gonna lurk first! You move on to someone else, I’m gonna be one step ahead of you, every single time! And then I’ll be on your ass every hour of every day ’til Monday, because that’s when I go home. When do you leave?

content.speaker: The Lurker
content.text: Also Monday.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What time? Maybe we can share a cab!

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s room, they’ve pretty much consumed the entire mini-bar. Needless to say, they’re feeling no pain and are still playing blackjack.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (He does so.) Hit me. (She slows down with each one.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We need more cards.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, and also we need more umm, drinks. Hold on a second. (Gets up but stumbles a little bit.) Whup, okay. (She makes it to the phone and picks it up, without dialing.) Hello! Vegas? Yeah, we would like some more alcohol, and y’know what else? We would like some more beers. Hello? Ohh, I forgot to dial!
(They both start laughing. There’s a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That must be our alcohol and beers! (Gets up to answer it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, it’s Joey! I love Joey! (Hugs him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, I love Joey! Joey lives with a duck! (Goes and hugs Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look-look-look you guys, I need some help! Okay? Someone is going to have to convince my hand twin to cooperate!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll do it. Hey, whatever you need me to do, I’m your man. (He starts to sit down on the bed. There’s one problem though, he’s about two feet to the left of it. Needless to say, he misses and falls on his butt.) (Looking up at Joey.) Whoa-oh-whoa! Are you, are you okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! I’m fine! Thanks! (He starts to leave, but gets an idea and stops.) Hey Rach, how you doin’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m doin’ good, baby. How you doin’?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross, don’t let her drink anymore! (Exits)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohh, here’s that Macadamia nut!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nope! Something else. (Throws it back under the bed.)
content.parenthetical: he puts it in his mouth

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oops! All right, so what do you want to do now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I wanna get out of the room! Y’know, I…I really miss downstairs.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, y’know what? There’s only one way I’m leaving this hotel room.

[Cut to the casino, a very drunk and doodled on Rachel is walking arm in arm with an equally drunk and doodled on Ross are walking through the casino and greeting people on their way through. Ross has some whiskers and his nose colored in, along with his name on his forehead.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well hello! I’m Ross!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good luck to ya!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me sir, you’ve got a little something right here. (He points to the corner of his mouth and they both laugh.)
(They’ve made their way to the statue of the naked man that Chandler was leaning against earlier.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Hello!
(They both continue on and Ross meows like a cat.)

content.description: [Scene: The slot machines, we see some guy not having any luck. Both Phoebe and the Lurker are lurking him and each stick their heads around the corner at different times This is all set to that Pink Panther song. Finally the guy gives up and walks past the lurker’s position, thus giving her the advantage. She scurries in and quickly drops a coin in the slot before Phoebe gets there. Phoebe arrives slightly later and pulls the arm just after the lurker deposits the coin and wins.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I won! I won! I finally won!

content.speaker: The Lurker
content.text: I won! That was my quarter!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine! Here! Take a hike toots! (Gives back her quarter.)
(The security guard approaches.)

content.speaker: The Lurker
content.text: Excuse me, sir! This lady played my quarter, this is my money. (Motions to the jackpot.)

content.speaker: The Security Guard
content.text: Is that true miss?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sells drugs to kids.

content.speaker: The Security Guard
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She sells drugs to kids. (The guard looks at the lurker.)

content.speaker: The Lurker
content.text: It was my quarter!

content.speaker: The Security Guard
content.text: Was it her quarter?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How about we talk about this over dinner?

content.speaker: The Security Guard
content.text: Okay lady, you’re out of here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! No, you can’t arrest me! No!! I won’t go back! I won’t go back to that hell hole!!

content.speaker: The Security Guard
content.text: I’m just taking you outside!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay. (Walks out.)

content.description: The Gift Shop, Monica and Chandler are entering.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, come on, I can’t get married until I get something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, all right, all right, all right! Okay! (Picks up a blue sweater.) Okay, here’s something, here’s something blue and new.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re so efficient. I love you!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let’s go! (Starts to leave.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No-no-no! We need something old!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ohh, great, I have condom in my wallet I’ve had since I was twelve.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’ll work!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, now we just need something borrowed!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here just…take this. (Hands her the sweater.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s stealing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, we’ll-we’ll bring it back! Just put it under your dress.
(She does so and it makes her look pregnant.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh. (Rubs her fake stomach.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, one thing at a time. (They run out to get married.)

content.description: [Scene: A blackjack table, Joey is moving in to try and get his hand twin (who’s dealing) to join him in his evil plot to rule the world! “Join me, and together we’ll rule the universe as father and son!” (Sorry, I had a little Star Wars creep in there—Ooh, I have a big spoiler for The Phantom Menace, Yoda lives at the end! Ha-ha, spoiled it! Now you don’t have to see it!)]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhh! (Slides his hands across the table.)

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Are you gonna play?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, I don’t really have any money. Not yet, anyway… (Shakes his hands.)

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: You can’t sit here if you’re not gonna play.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh-ho-ho! (The dealer stares at him and he stops.)
content.parenthetical: throws down a small wad of money, and as his hand twin starts to unfold it, Joey once again brings attention to their special gift to the world. {Y’know, looking at it now, they really don’t have that similar of hands. Joey’s are bigger.}

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello. My name is Regina Phalange. I’m a businesswoman in town on business. Would you like to see my card? (Looks down) Ooh, what did I do with my file-a-facts? I must’ve left it in conference room B.
content.parenthetical: entering and sitting down at the table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hit me! (He does so.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! May I just say that you two gentlemen have the exact same hands! They’re identical! Now, I’ve never seen anything like that in the business world.

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Stop it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, Ms. Phalange, may I ask you a question as an impartial person at-at this table?

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Please stop it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wouldn’t you pay good money to see these identical hands showcased in some type of a uh, entertainment venue?

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: If you leave now, I will chop off my hand and give it too you!
(The security guard from before approaches and Phoebe tries to turn her back on him.)

content.speaker: The Security Guard
content.text: Didn’t I just throw you out of here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, you threw out Phoebe. I’m Ms. Regina Phalange. Phalange!

content.speaker: The Security Guard
content.text: Come on, lady! (Starts to escort her out.)

content.speaker: Joey’s Hand Twin
content.text: Please, please take him too. (Motions to Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me?! Oh come on, man! You can’t do this! Come on! (Being dragged out by the guard) I’m your hand twin!!

content.description: [Scene: A Little White Chapel, Chandler and Monica are entering.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello! One marriage please!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yep, we wanna get married!

content.speaker: The Attendant
content.text: Well, there’s a service in progress. Have a seat.

content.speaker: Chandler and Monica
content.text: All right.
(They both sit down.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dum! Dum-dum-dum! Dum! Dum! Dum! Dum-dum-dum!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s The Wedding March . Does, does that freak you out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, only because that’s the graduation song.
(The real Wedding March begins playing from behind the closed doors of the chapel.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay! (Stands up) This is it! (Claps his hands) We’re gonna get married!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Are you sure you wanna do this?
(Suddenly the doors burst open, and Ross AND Rachel COME OUT ARM-IN-ARM!!!!! And Rachel’s carrying a bouquet!!! THEY GOT MARRIED!!!!)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, hello, Mrs. Ross! (Throws some rice.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, hello, Mr. Rachel! (Throws some more rice.)
(They storm out into the street.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait! (Gets her bearings) Okay!

(She goes one way; he goes the other. The camera pans back to Chandler and Monica, and needless to say, they’re standing there dumbstruck as The King’s (Elvis Presley to the yougin’s) Viva, Las Vegas begins to play. Sing along with me now, “Viva! Las Vegas! Vivaaaaaa! Vivaaaaa! Las Vegassssss!!” Fade to Black.)
[That’s all folks, no teaser; just the big cliffhanger for season 6. Yes, there will be a season 6, and it’ll start again in September. Have a good summer everyone!]
